In reading some of the other reviews I’d like to say in defense of this Airbnb, - You’d Be Crazy Not To Stay Here!
There’s not a hotel in this world where you don’t hear a child/person through the walls or in the hallway, causing a ruckus!
Now with that being said, I did not find any issues with children being annoying. By 10am you’d hear a little muffled noises of children, but that’s about it. It was quiet and peaceful in the time I was ever inside. Yes maybe there might be the odd day where a child might cry but not 24/7 a week!
Garret and Nerisa clearly informs you that there are children on the premises and if you don’t like that then don’t book it. I’ll just add, if you do book it and hit an odd day, DON’T complain about it as if these people are villains!!! I find that so tacky.
THIS place is the BOMB! The bed is fantastic, accompanied by a cozy fireplace. The bathroom is the max. There is a fridge, with bottled water in it, a microwave and coffee machine available for one’s convenience, but no kitchen sink, just like you wouldn’t find in a hotel room! What you see in the photo gallery is what you get!
The whole place is a very spacious suite, clean and worthy of 5 STARS.
Like wise, the hosts are the BOMB! They go out of their way to help you, responding to every contact, and if you have an issue, they’ll accommodate you: just holler out and they’ll take care of it… they’ll go out of their way because their goal is to sincerely be the 5 star experience and they truly are.
The location is beautiful and close to shops. Easy access to any recreation/entertainment.
I just love this place! So happy I stayed here and so glad I booked it again for next month. I’ll be a regular at this Airbnb every time I’m in this area.

This is a nice home and accommodations. Good host.
As pictured, this space has a large king bed and large spa bathroom. Not pictured is a remote control operated electric fireplace.
Some things to note:
This property has several parking spots so you need to communicate with the owners where they want you to park.
Clean towels provided but provide your own toiletries, plastic ware & paper plates if you plan to eat or reheat food.
There are 10 steps, not pictured, from ground level to the room.
This home is in a residential neighborhood and borders other homes. I never saw wildlife in the yard of this AirBnB as posted in the website photographs.
The AirBnB room shares a thin wall with a family home. The family has small children who live on small children time. The owner warned me of presence of children and I did not explore with more questions. Mea culpa. There were 3 children under the age of 5 the afternoon I arrived.
I booked this property for 3 nights but checked out after the 2nd night. The noise of the children woke me up as I tried to sleep in the 2nd day. It was a rainy day. I went out for a while to get food and read and take a break. When I came back a couple hours later, I hoped to pass the rainy afternoon reading but there just wasn’t peace and quiet so I checked out early and went to a beautiful hotel for my final night of vacation.
The reading nook featured in the pictures is two chairs positioned for visiting as you enter the room. This is one large studio type room and not really a reading chair or sitting area.
When you walk out the door, there is a shared deck with the family home that opens to the family’s back yard, Children’s trampoline and neighbor’s backyard.
They provide free Wi-Fi, coffee, microwave, restaurant suggestions and walking/hiking suggestions. I was very grateful the host helped me carry my luggage up the steps as I recently had cervical surgery.
This is a bed and bathroom for a great price but it is not a space for reading or sitting outside or observing nature, naps, or any other activities except maybe watching tv, which they also provide.
